parody.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a piece of writing, music etc or an action that copies someone or something in an amusing way
parody.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Her performance contains a strong element of self-parody  (=when someone makes fun of their own style).
a brilliant parody of classical dance
He swung the door wide open in a parody of welcome.
parody.translation[0].definitions[1].def: something that is not a correct or acceptable example of something
parody.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The trial was a parody of justice  (=very unfair).
Although his comment was a parody of the truth, Diana was upset by it.
parody.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to copy someone or something in a way that makes people laugh
parody.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: His style has often been parodied.
